p: Phylogenetic analysis was used to determine the subtype distribution in the full coastal Kenya sequence dataset (N = 658). In total, 431 subtype A (66%), 46 subtype C (7%), 69 subtype D (10%), 2 subtype G (>1%), and 110 CRF and unique recombinant form (URFs, 17%) sequences were identified (Table 1 and Supplementary Fig. S1). In addition, all subtype A sequences belonged to sub-subtype A1. Detailed recombination analyses of newly generated sequences demonstrated extensive recombination between subtypes, sub-subtypes, and recombinant forms (Supplementary Table S2).
